intro: Somerauera cherlerioides, commonly known as the Huaihua plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Vietnam and Cambodia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
